PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Peripheral Blood Mononuclear Cell Frozen Specimen

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Peripheral Blood Mononuclear Cell Frozen Specimen
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A monocyte found in the general circulation.: A specimen that has been subjected to and immobilized by severe cold.

Concepts.definition: A peripheral blood cell with a single nucleus. This category includes lymphocytes and monocytes.
A specimen that has been subjected to and immobilized by severe cold.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural functional changes that result from disease processes.  Informally used to mean the result of such an examination.: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Concepts.definition: The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural and functional changes that result from the disease processes. Informally used to mean the result of such an examination.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.: One type of white blood cell that attacks virus-infected cells, foreign cells, and cancer cells.  T cells also produce a number of substances that regulate the immune response.: Cells of a single type that have been grown in the laboratory for several generations (cell divisions).

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

A thymocyte-derived lymphocyte of immunological importance that is long-lived (months to years) and is responsible for cell-mediated immunity. T lymphocyte cells form rosettes with sheep erythrocytes and, in the presence of transforming agents (mitogens), differentiate and divide. These cells have the characteristic T3 surface marker and may be further divided into subsets according to function, such as helper, cytotoxic, etc.
A permanently established cell culture that will proliferate indefinitely given appropriate fresh medium and space.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A virus in the family herpesviridae and the type species of rhadinovirus. It is an enveloped virus with a genome consisting of a single segment of double-stranded DNA that is approximately 112kb in length. It normally infects squirrel monkeys, where it creates a persistent infection.: One type of white blood cell that attacks virus-infected cells, foreign cells, and cancer cells.  T cells also produce a number of substances that regulate the immune response.: Cells of a single type that have been grown in the laboratory for several generations (cell divisions).

Concepts.definition: A virus in the family herpesviridae and the type species of rhadinovirus. It is an enveloped virus with a genome consisting of a single segment of double-stranded DNA that is approximately 112kb in length. It normally infects squirrel monkeys, where it creates a persistent infection.

A thymocyte-derived lymphocyte of immunological importance that is long-lived (months to years) and is responsible for cell-mediated immunity. T lymphocyte cells form rosettes with sheep erythrocytes and, in the presence of transforming agents (mitogens), differentiate and divide. These cells have the characteristic T3 surface marker and may be further divided into subsets according to function, such as helper, cytotoxic, etc.
A permanently established cell culture that will proliferate indefinitely given appropriate fresh medium and space.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A connective tissue cell that makes and secretes collagen proteins.: Cells of a single type that have been grown in the laboratory for several generations (cell divisions).

Concepts.definition: A connective tissue cell that makes and secretes collagen proteins.
A permanently established cell culture that will proliferate indefinitely given appropriate fresh medium and space.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A species of Herpetoviridae that is responsible for infectious mononucleosis (glandular fever). Discovered in 1964, this virus has been associated with Burkitt's lymphoma in South African children and with nasopharyngeal carcinoma in Asian populations.: Lymphoid cells concerned with humoral immunity. They are short-lived cells resembling bursa-derived lymphocytes of birds in their production of immunoglobulin upon appropriate stimulation.: Cells of a single type that have been grown in the laboratory for several generations (cell divisions).

Concepts.definition: A species of Herpetoviridae that is responsible for infectious mononucleosis (glandular fever). Discovered in 1964, this virus has been associated with Burkitt's lymphoma in South African children and with nasopharyngeal carcinoma in Asian populations.

Immunologically important lymphocyte that is not thymus-dependent, is either short-lived and naive or long-lived and of memory phenotype, and resembles the bursa-derived lymphocyte of birds in that it is responsible for the production of immunoglobulins.
A permanently established cell culture that will proliferate indefinitely given appropriate fresh medium and space.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Single-stranded long chain of nucleotides containing ribose. It is the end product of DNA transcription by the enzyme RNA polymerase. It is essential in protein synthesis.

Concepts.definition: Single-stranded long chain of nucleotides containing ribose. It is the end product of DNA transcription by the enzyme RNA polymerase. It is essential in protein synthesis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 1/25/23 added alt name for ticket number CADSR0001948 for CCTG cjl.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The clear liquid part of the blood that remains after blood cells and clotting proteins have been removed.

Concepts.definition: The clear portion of the blood that remains after the removal of the blood cells and the clotting proteins.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A long linear double-stranded polymer formed from nucleotides attached to a deoxyribose backbone and found in the nucleus of a cell; associated with the transmission of genetic information.

Concepts.definition: A long linear double-stranded polymer formed from nucleotides attached to a deoxyribose backbone and found in the nucleus of a cell; associated with the transmission of genetic information.

Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
